avalancheActivity.highlights: Sunshine and high temperatures will give rise as the day progresses to increasing moistening of the snowpack.
avalancheActivity.comment:
In some localities 5 cm of snow has fallen above approximately 2700 m. As a consequence of warming during the day and the solar radiation, the likelihood of moist and wet avalanches being released will increase gradually in particular on steep slopes above approximately 2500 m. The new snow can be released by a single winter sport participant. This applies in particular in gullies and bowls on extremely steep slopes at high altitudes and in high Alpine regions.
Backcountry touring calls for caution and restraint.

snowpackStructure.comment: Sunshine and high temperatures will give rise as the day progresses to increasing moistening of the snowpack in all aspects. These conditions will cause a gradual weakening of the snowpack. Below approximately 1900 m hardly any snow is lying.
